docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: S3 Mount S3 Bucket on linux # Install prerequisites yum install automake fuse fuse-devel gcc-c++ git libcurl-devel libxml2-devel make openssl-devel -y # Create mountpoint cd /srv mkdir s3fs cd s3fs/ # Obtain s3fs-fuse. sudo amazon-linux-extras install epel sudo yum install s3fs-fuse
docs.title: S3

docs.text: # Install prerequisites yum install automake fuse fuse-devel gcc-c++ git libcurl-devel libxml2-devel make openssl-devel -y # Create mountpoint cd /srv mkdir s3fs cd s3fs/ # Obtain s3fs-fuse. sudo amazon-linux-extras install epel sudo yum install s3fs-fuse
docs.title: Mount S3 Bucket on linux

docs.text: Linux Did you forget to sudo vi? :w !sudo tee "%" Find and kill processes with certain name for pid in $(ps -aux | grep "<eg: python follower>" | awk {'print $2'}); do kill $pid; done Add and delete Linux users with PEM Add user sudo adduser <username> sudo su <username> cd mkdir .ssh chmod 700 .ssh cd touch .ssh/authorized_keys chmod 600 .ssh/authorized_keys #AÑADIR LA CLAVE QUE QUERAMOS, cuidado con los saltos de línea, tiene que ir todo en una sola linea echo "ssh-rsa yStyZ7kEuyhgD3U/bqRyFFlOEB/6TGpKTv3V8GgrMa8evVO8lQ49VALZilH5rV58vp1N5TSMpxl0+CWchCkimBx6Fo2meFm7xqR7Z p-10cepluskeypairmoodle" >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys Delete user sudo userdel -r <userame> Home - End keys not working on oh-my-zsh Add this to ~/.zshrc bindkey "^[[1~" beginning-of-line bindkey "^[[4~" end-of-line
docs.title: Linux
Did you forget to sudo vi?

docs.text: for pid in $(ps -aux | grep "<eg: python follower>" | awk {'print $2'}); do kill $pid; done
docs.title: Find and kill processes with certain name
Add and delete Linux users with PEM

docs.text: sudo adduser <username> sudo su <username> cd mkdir .ssh chmod 700 .ssh cd touch .ssh/authorized_keys chmod 600 .ssh/authorized_keys #AÑADIR LA CLAVE QUE QUERAMOS, cuidado con los saltos de línea, tiene que ir todo en una sola linea echo "ssh-rsa yStyZ7kEuyhgD3U/bqRyFFlOEB/6TGpKTv3V8GgrMa8evVO8lQ49VALZilH5rV58vp1N5TSMpxl0+CWchCkimBx6Fo2meFm7xqR7Z p-10cepluskeypairmoodle" >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
docs.title: Add user

docs.text: Add this to ~/.zshrc bindkey "^[[1~" beginning-of-line bindkey "^[[4~" end-of-line
docs.title: Home - End keys not working on oh-my-zsh

docs.text: Oracle Visualization > sqplus / as sysdba SQL> set lines 300 pages 30000 SQL> select * from v$instance; Import and Export Schema For both import and export process, the folder must exists both defined as Oracle directories and in the filesystem. Import Note The schema will be created if it doesn't exists, and it should have the same password as the origin schema. SQL> impdp sys/pass remap_schema=SOURCE_SCHEMA:DEST_SCHEMA directory=exp_dir dumpfile=DUMP_FILENAME.dmp logfile=impdp_DUMP_FILENAME.log Export SQL> expdp SCHEMA_TO_EXPORT/PASSWORD directory=exp_dir dumpfile=DUMP_FILENAME.dmp logfile=export_DUMP_FILENAME.log filesize=1g Show active databases SQL> SELECT INSTANCE_NAME, DATABASE_STATUS, INSTANCE_ROLE from v$instance;
docs.title: Oracle

docs.text: > sqplus / as sysdba SQL> set lines 300 pages 30000 SQL> select * from v$instance;
docs.title: Visualization

docs.text: For both import and export process, the folder must exists both defined as Oracle directories and in the filesystem.
docs.title: Import and Export Schema

docs.text: Note The schema will be created if it doesn't exists, and it should have the same password as the origin schema. SQL> impdp sys/pass remap_schema=SOURCE_SCHEMA:DEST_SCHEMA directory=exp_dir dumpfile=DUMP_FILENAME.dmp logfile=impdp_DUMP_FILENAME.log
docs.title: Import

docs.text: SQL> expdp SCHEMA_TO_EXPORT/PASSWORD directory=exp_dir dumpfile=DUMP_FILENAME.dmp logfile=export_DUMP_FILENAME.log filesize=1g
docs.title: Export

docs.text: SQL> SELECT INSTANCE_NAME, DATABASE_STATUS, INSTANCE_ROLE from v$instance;
docs.title: Show active databases
